thread.title: Video: Queen Mary 2 in numbers
thread.title_full: Video: Queen Mary 2 in numbers - Telegraph

author: Telegraph Travel
title: Video: Queen Mary 2 in numbers
text: Cunard is celebrate the 175th anniversary of its first transatlantic sailing this month. On Saturday, its ship Queen Mary 2 will (following a grand send-off) leave Liverpool bound for Halifax, Nova Scotia - the same route taken by the RMS Britannia back in 1840. From there it will visit Boston and New York, where further fanfare can be expected, before it heads back to Blighty. • Liverpool and Cunard: a very special relationship • Meet Cunard's first and only female captain Adrian Bridge will be on board the cruise, reporting for Telegraph Travel. In the meantime, we've unearthed these fascinating facts about the cruise ship. To find out more about Cunard's 175-year history, see our gallery . Follow this link to see what life on board a cruise ship was like in 1840 . • The world's best cruise lines • Queen Mary 2: review
